intro: Aulomyrcia bimarginata, commonly known as the two-margin fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
